name: Please refrain from using inline ignore pragmas `# hadolint ignore=DLxxxx`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL1001" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use absolute WORKDIR.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3000" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: For some bash commands it makes no sense running them in a Docker container like ssh, vim, shutdown, service, ps, free, top, kill, mount, ifconfig.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3001" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Last user should not be root.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3002" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use WORKDIR to switch to a directory.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3003" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Do not use sudo as it leads to unpredictable behavior. Use a tool like gosu to enforce root.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3004" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Always tag the version of an image explicitly.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3006" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Using latest is prone to errors if the image will ever update. Pin the version explicitly to a release tag.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3007" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in `apt-get install`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3008" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Delete the apt-get lists after installing something.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3009" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use ADD for extracting archives into an image.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3010" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Valid UNIX ports range from 0 to 65535.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3011" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Multiple `HEALTHCHECK` instructions.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3012" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in pip.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3013" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use the `-y` switch.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3014" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Avoid additional packages by specifying `--no-install-recommends`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3015" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in `npm`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3016" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in `apk add`. Instead of `apk add <package>` use `apk add <package>=<version>`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3018" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use the `--no-cache` switch to avoid the need to use `--update` and remove `/var/cache/apk/*` when done installing packages.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3019" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use `COPY` instead of `ADD` for files and folders.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3020" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `COPY` with more than 2 arguments requires the last argument to end with `/`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3021" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `COPY --from` should reference a previously defined `FROM` alias
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3022" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `COPY --from` cannot reference its own `FROM` alias
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3023" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `FROM` aliases (stage names) must be unique
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3024" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use arguments JSON notation for CMD and ENTRYPOINT arguments
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3025" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use only an allowed registry in the `FROM image`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3026" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Do not use `apt` as it is meant to be an end-user tool, use `apt-get` or `apt-cache` instead
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3027" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in gem install. Instead of `gem install <gem>` use `gem install <gem>:<version>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3028" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Do not use --platform flag with FROM.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3029" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use the `-y` switch to avoid manual input `yum install -y <package>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3030" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `yum clean all` missing after yum command.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3032" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Specify version with `yum install -y <package>-<version>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3033" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Non-interactive switch missing from `zypper` command: `zypper install -y`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3034" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Do not use `zypper dist-upgrade`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3035" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `zypper clean` missing after zypper use.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3036" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Specify version with `zypper install -y <package>[=]<version>`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3037" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use the `-y` switch to avoid manual input `dnf install -y <package>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3038" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `dnf clean all` missing after dnf command.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3040" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Specify version with `dnf install -y <package>-<version>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3041" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Avoid cache directory with `pip install --no-cache-dir <package>`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3042" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `ONBUILD`, `FROM` or `MAINTAINER` triggered from within `ONBUILD` instruction.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3043" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Do not refer to an environment variable within the same `ENV` statement where it is defined.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3044" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `COPY` to a relative destination without `WORKDIR` set.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3045" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `useradd` without flag `-l` and high UID will result in excessively large Image.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3046" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `wget` without flag `--progress` will result in excessively bloated build logs when downloading larger files.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3047" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Invalid Label Key
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3048" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is missing.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3049" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Superfluous label(s) present.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3050" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is empty.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3051" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is not a valid URL.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3052" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is not a valid time format - must conform to RFC3339.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3053" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is not a valid SPDX license identifier.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3054" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is not a valid git hash.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3055" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` does not conform to semantic versioning.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3056" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `HEALTHCHECK` instruction missing.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3057" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Label `<label>` is not a valid email format - must conform to RFC5322.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3058" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Multiple consecutive `RUN` instructions. Consider consolidation.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3059" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `yarn cache clean` missing after `yarn install` was run.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3060" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Invalid instruction order. Dockerfile must begin with `FROM`, `ARG` or comment.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3061" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Pin versions in go install. Instead of `go install <package>` use `go install <package>@<version>`
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL3062" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `MAINTAINER` is deprecated.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4000" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Either use Wget or Curl but not both.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4001" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Multiple `CMD` instructions found.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4003" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Multiple `ENTRYPOINT` instructions found.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4004" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use `SHELL` to change the default shell.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4005" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Set the `SHELL` option -o pipefail before `RUN` with a pipe in it
description: This issue is raised by the rule "DL4006" from "Hadolint". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `$` is not used specially and should therefore be escaped.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1000" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: This `\c` will be a regular `'c'` in this context.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1001" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Remove space after `=` if trying to assign a value (or for empty string, use `var='' ...`).
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1007" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use semicolon or linefeed before `done` (or quote to make it literal).
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1010" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: This is a unicode non-breaking space. Delete it and retype as space.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1018" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: You need a space here
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1035" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: It's not `foo &; bar`, just `foo & bar`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1045" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Trying to declare parameters? Don't. Use `()` and refer to params as `$1`, `$2` etc.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1065" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Don't use $ on the left side of assignments.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1066" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Don't put spaces around the `=` in assignments.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1068" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: For command expansion, the tick should slant left (\` vs Â´).
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1077" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Did you forget to close this double-quoted string?
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1078" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: This is actually an end quote, but due to next char, it looks suspect.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1079" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Scripts are case sensitive. Use `if`, not `If`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1081" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: This `{/}` is literal. Check expression (missing `;/\n`?) or quote it.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1083" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Don't use `$` on the iterator name in for loops.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1086" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Braces are required when expanding arrays, as in `${array[idx]}`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1087" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Not following: Reasons include: file not found, no permissions, not included on the command line, not allowing shellcheck to follow files with -x, etc.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1091" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: You need a space or linefeed between the function name and body.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1095" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Unexpected `==`. For assignment, use `=`. For comparison, use `[ .. ]` or `[[ .. ]]`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1097" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Quote/escape special characters when using `eval`, e.g. `eval "a=(b)"`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1098" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: You need a space before the `#`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC1099" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Useless cat. Consider cmd < file | .. or cmd file | .. instead.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2002" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Note that A && B || C is not if-then-else. C may run when A is true.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2015" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: This word is outside of quotes. Did you intend to 'nest '"'single quotes'"' instead'?
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2026" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: `echo` won't expand escape sequences. Consider `printf`.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2028" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use `./*glob*` or `-- *glob*` so names with dashes won't become options.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2035" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: In POSIX sh, something is undefined.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2039" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Quote this to prevent word splitting
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2046" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2086" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Word is in the form `"A"B"C"` (B indicated). Did you mean `"ABC"` or `"A\"B\"C"`?
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2140" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: var is referenced but not assigned.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2154" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2155" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Use cd ... || exit in case `cd` fails.
description: This issue is raised by the rule "SC2164" from "ShellCheck". This is not an issue raised by Sonar analyzers.

name: Hadolint Rule
description: This reporting may be triggered by a custom Hadolint rule or by a default Hadolint rule that has not yet been added to the Sonar IaC analyzer.
